subject: RE: [junit] Re: Quick trawl
msgSnippet: ... Yeah, our initial integration of junit into bluej was along these lines. We re working on some other features such as visually distinguishing test classes
messageBody:
> Really you'd just need a button or something to
> instantiate a test runner, right?
>
> Something like:
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> junit.swingui.TestRunner tr =
> new junit.swingui.TestRunner();
> tr.run(AllTests.class);
> }

Yeah, our initial integration of junit into
bluej was along these lines. We're working on
some other features such as visually distinguishing
test classes and using BlueJ's object interaction
to construct test cases and fixtures. These are
the bits that are taking some time.

Unfortunately the currently released version has
no support for junit and no extensibility features
(it is primarily for 1st year students after all)..
I was suggesting for Dave adding a class to his
student's projects that instantiates the swingrunner.
Because BlueJ lets you interactively execute code of the
classes in your project it would probably be possible
to let the students get at the swing runner this way
(in the current version of bluej).

Andrew
